intro: Humularia apiculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and the flowers are yellow with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Humularia apiculata is often found in open habitats and is relatively hardy, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
